common_issues.title: Pieces OS fails to launch due to various errors
common_issues.description: Users are reporting Pieces OS failing to launch on Windows and macOS.  Error messages include 'AVX2 not supported' and getting stuck on 'ensure core dependencies'. Proposed solutions include reinstalling, waiting for data migration, and checking processor compatibility. A patch is expected soon to address these issues.

related_issues.title: Pieces os doesn't launch at all for past week. Can't use pieces at all
related_issues.text:
Pieces os doesn't launch at all for past week. Can't use pieces at all
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

For the past week, anytime that I launch pieces I see this: 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/61f18fb6-8846-46d8-8747-5c415fd2e82d)

Pieces OS just doesn't open, no matter what.

I tried to reinstall everything, but also no progress.

How to fix it? (Also to mention, Pieces desktop app is in Early Access program, but I don't know if this information is useful)
## Summary of GitHub issue conversation
**Key points raised:**

* User `GetReal444` is unable to boot the Pieces OS application.
* Error message mentions "AVX2 not supported on this processor".
* Support bot suggests related issues and helpful resources.
* `mark-at-pieces` requests user to provide additional information and share logs.
* User shares logs indicating the error and mentions it appears in previous logs as well.

**Problems identified:**

* User's processor lacks AVX2 support, required by the database service.
* This issue affects more users than initially expected.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* `mark-at-pieces` suggests providing a screenshot of the user's machine tech specs.
* Team is actively discussing solutions and expects a patch within 24-48 hours.

**Current status/outcome:**

* Issue is under investigation and a resolution is expected soon.

**Additional details:**

* This issue is a continuation of a previous one (https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/620). 
* It appears to be impacting a wider range of users than initially thought. 
* The team is working on a solution and expects a patch to be released within 24-48 hours. 
* In the meantime, users are encouraged to provide screenshots of their machine tech specs for further diagnosis.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS was unable to launch.
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS was unable to launch.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

latest

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7a6a7957-5aa1-4d53-b492-cf4470aa5edc)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* DevWizard24 is experiencing issues launching the Pieces OS.
* Similar issues have been reported in other GitHub issues.

**Problems Identified:**

* Hardware requirements for Pieces OS 11.1.1 are stricter than expected, causing launch issues for some users.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The Pieces team is working on a patch to address the issue.
* DevWizard24 is asked to provide their support logs for further analysis.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* A patch is expected within 24-48 hours.

**Additional Notes:**

* Mark-at-pieces provided instructions for obtaining support logs.
* The provided resources (existing issues, documentation, YouTube channel) may be helpful for troubleshooting.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.5

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I got a popup that there was a new version of Pieces OS and that I needed to click and restart to update. But now the desktop app won't start anymore, being stuck on the core dependencies.

I can click on the link, but nothing changes when I do that.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/716af38b-6a71-4162-80f8-b9e9e44f7059)
## Summary of GitHub issue conversation regarding PiecesOS boot-up issue:

**Key points raised:**

* **Issue:** PiecesOS taking a long time to boot up or failing to start completely. 
* **Reported by:** Multiple users, including rogierlegit, Shamas-Habib, and JasonDWilson.
* **Platforms affected:** Windows and macOS.
* **Symptoms:**
    * PiecesOS not appearing in the tray.
    * Stuck on the "ensure core dependencies" step.
    * Handshake errors in the logs.
* **Possible causes:**
    * Major data migration in version 11.1.0.
    * Outdated app installer.
    * Processor older than 2015.
    * OneDrive conflict.

**Problems identified:**

* Initial solution for Windows users did not resolve the issue for everyone.
* Some users reported issues on macOS that were not addressed in the Windows solution.
* Shamas-Habib experienced the issue again after reinstalling Windows.
* JasonDWilson's issue persisted even after updating to version 11.1.1.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* **Version 11.1.0:**
    * Give PiecesOS a few minutes to migrate data.
    * Restart the Pieces for Developers Desktop application.
    * Contact support if the issue persists.
* **Version 11.1.1:**
    * Users experiencing issues on Windows were advised to uninstall and reinstall. 
* **Updated app installer:** 
    * Provided as a potential solution for users facing issues with the initial Windows installer.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue has been resolved for some users, including Shamas-Habib, after updating to version 11.1.1. 
* JasonDWilson reported that the issue persisted even after the update.
* Additional information was requested from JasonDWilson to help diagnose the problem further.

## Additional notes:

* rogierlegit and Shamas-Habib were both experiencing the issue, but on different platforms. 
* Shamas-Habib's initial issue appears to have been resolved with a clean Windows install. 
* JasonDWilson's issue remains unresolved and requires further investigation.
* The PiecesOS team has acknowledged the OneDrive conflict and is working on a fix.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS fails to launch after update
common_issues.description: Users report PiecesOS failing to launch or getting stuck during startup, particularly after updating to version 11.1.0 or 11.1.1.  This issue appears on Windows and macOS, potentially due to stricter hardware requirements, data migration issues, or conflicts with OneDrive. Proposed solutions include reinstalling PiecesOS, waiting for data migration to complete, or using an updated installer. The Pieces team is actively working on resolving these issues.

related_issues.title: Cannot launch pieces-for-developers after new installation on MacOS Sequoia 15.2 M1 chip
related_issues.text:
Cannot launch pieces-for-developers after new installation on MacOS Sequoia 15.2 M1 chip
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I cannot install pieces Desktop App, or it fails to run.  I originally reported this by email on 9 Jan 2025, and the response email referred to an existing issue on github #546.  However this issue now seems closed, hence I am raising it here as a new bug.
 
I have recently installed pieces OS on my Mac with a package dmg.  The pieces OS appears to install, and I see the icon in the top bar.  Pieces appears to connect to the cloud successfully, and I can install plugins for Intellij, VSCode and Obsidian.  These are visible within the pieces OS icon at the top.  
 
Pieces appears to work from IDE plugins.   However I cannot launch the Desktop App, and ‘launch pieces for developers’ from the top Pieces menu fails silently.

I have recently upgraded Pieces OS, now on 11.1.1
 
Info:
 
Mac OS: Sequoia 15.2
Chip: Apple M1 Pro
 
Pieces OS: 11.1.1 (was installed as 11.0.3(
Pieces desktop app – won’t install
Pieces OS seems to be running in ‘activity monitor’
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* PASimmons reported an issue running Pieces OS on their M1 Mac.
* They were initially using an incorrect build (Intel instead of Apple Silicon).

**Problems Identified:**

* Incorrect build for the user's system architecture (Intel vs Apple Silicon).

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Uninstalling and reinstalling Pieces OS using the correct architecture (Apple Silicon).

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issue resolved. User confirmed Pieces for Developers is running successfully.
* Related announcement for further information available in issue #615.
* Mark_at_pieces closed the issue as resolved.

**Additional Information:**

* User was provided additional resources for support and troubleshooting.
* Mark_at_pieces offered real-time debugging assistance if needed.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Download and Startup Failures
common_issues.description: Users report PiecesOS failing to download models, start, or complete updates. Issues involve dependency errors, slow boot times, and application crashes. Proposed solutions include reinstalling the application, updating to the latest version, and providing logs for further analysis.

related_issues.title: Models Download Fail
related_issues.text:
Models Download Fail
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I'm not able to download any of the models for ollama.
[log-02022025.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18631166/log-02022025.txt)

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8e93857a-de7e-4e62-b3d0-c6a68b48631e
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Issue:** Ollama failed to install in Pieces OS

**Author:** surya-sengupta

**Key Points:**

* The issue was reported on February 2, 2025.
* The user experienced Ollama installation failure.
* The user confirmed the issue persisted after updating to Pieces OS version 11.1.0.
* The user provided additional logs for further troubleshooting.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Pieces support team suggested updating to Pieces OS version 11.1.0.
* The user requested further assistance and provided additional logs.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is still under investigation.
* Pieces support team requested additional logs for further analysis.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue may be related to a specific configuration or environmental factor.
* More information is needed to diagnose the root cause of the problem.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Boot and Launch Issues
common_issues.description: Users reported PiecesOS failing to boot or launch, particularly after updating to version 11.1.0 or 11.1.1.  This issue affected both macOS and Windows users.  Suggested solutions included ensuring the correct architecture build is installed, allowing sufficient time for data migration, restarting the application, and reinstalling PiecesOS. Some users experienced persistent issues requiring further investigation.

related_issues.title: Unable to Boot PiecesOS on Macos(Arm architecture) After updating to 11.1.0
related_issues.text: Unable to Boot PiecesOS on Macos(Arm architecture) After updating to 11.1.0 If you cannot open PiecesOS after updating to 11.1.0 and you are on an arm Machine M1, M2, M3,...etc then it is likely that you accidentally installed the intel version of the application. If you are Unsure. Please uninstall Pieces OS from your applications folder and reinstall from https://docs.pieces.app/installation-getting-started/macos (Arm == Apple Silicon) You can tell if you are working with Arm architecture if you see something that resembles this within your 'About this Mac' If you are still having issues after trying these steps please feel free to add a comment on this issue and schedule a time on my calendar here. https://calendar.app.google/MGd9i5gELtiDjWZm8 No comments found on this issue.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS boot-up and launch issues
common_issues.description: Users report PiecesOS failing to launch or experiencing slow boot-up times, often getting stuck on "ensure core dependencies". This affects both Windows and macOS. Proposed solutions include allowing time for data migration, reinstalling the application, and using an updated installer. While some users found resolution, others continue to face the issue, prompting further investigation by the PiecesOS team.

* Mark-at-pieces provided instructions for obtaining support logs.
* The provided resources (existing issues, documentation, YouTube channel) may be helpful for troubleshooting.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.5

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I got a popup that there was a new version of Pieces OS and that I needed to click and restart to update. But now the desktop app won't start anymore, being stuck on the core dependencies.

I can click on the link, but nothing changes when I do that.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/716af38b-6a71-4162-80f8-b9e9e44f7059)
## Summary of GitHub issue conversation regarding PiecesOS boot-up issue:

**Key points raised:**

* **Issue:** PiecesOS taking a long time to boot up or failing to start completely. 
* **Reported by:** Multiple users, including rogierlegit, Shamas-Habib, and JasonDWilson.
* **Platforms affected:** Windows and macOS.
* **Symptoms:**
    * PiecesOS not appearing in the tray.
    * Stuck on the "ensure core dependencies" step.
    * Handshake errors in the logs.
* **Possible causes:**
    * Major data migration in version 11.1.0.
    * Outdated app installer.
    * Processor older than 2015.
    * OneDrive conflict.

**Problems identified:**

* Initial solution for Windows users did not resolve the issue for everyone.
* Some users reported issues on macOS that were not addressed in the Windows solution.
* Shamas-Habib experienced the issue again after reinstalling Windows.
* JasonDWilson's issue persisted even after updating to version 11.1.1.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* **Version 11.1.0:**
    * Give PiecesOS a few minutes to migrate data.
    * Restart the Pieces for Developers Desktop application.
    * Contact support if the issue persists.
* **Version 11.1.1:**
    * Users experiencing issues on Windows were advised to uninstall and reinstall. 
* **Updated app installer:** 
    * Provided as a potential solution for users facing issues with the initial Windows installer.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue has been resolved for some users, including Shamas-Habib, after updating to version 11.1.1. 
* JasonDWilson reported that the issue persisted even after the update.
* Additional information was requested from JasonDWilson to help diagnose the problem further.

## Additional notes:

* rogierlegit and Shamas-Habib were both experiencing the issue, but on different platforms. 
* Shamas-Habib's initial issue appears to have been resolved with a clean Windows install. 
* JasonDWilson's issue remains unresolved and requires further investigation.
* The PiecesOS team has acknowledged the OneDrive conflict and is working on a fix.

recommendations: **Prioritize PiecesOS Launch Issues:** Focus on resolving the widespread boot and launch issues affecting PiecesOS, particularly those related to updates 11.1.0 and 11.1.1. This will directly impact a large number of users.

**Improve Hardware Compatibility and Communication:** Address the root cause of hardware incompatibility issues, such as AVX2 support, and clearly communicate minimum system requirements to prevent future installation problems.
**Investigate Data Migration Problems:** Thoroughly investigate and resolve issues related to data migration during updates, as this appears to be a recurring problem for users.

**Enhance Update Process and Communication:** Implement measures to ensure smoother updates, including clear communication about potential downtime, data migration processes, and rollback options in case of issues.
**Provide Detailed Troubleshooting Guides:** Create comprehensive troubleshooting guides for common issues, including log file analysis, to empower users to resolve problems independently.

**Consider a Dedicated Support Forum:** Explore creating a dedicated support forum or community platform for users to share their issues, solutions, and workarounds. This can foster a sense of community and reduce the load on the support team.
**Gather User Feedback on Updates:** Implement a system for gathering user feedback after updates to proactively identify and address emerging issues.
**Monitor Support Channels Closely:** Continue to closely monitor support channels, including GitHub issues, to identify and address new or recurring problems promptly.
**Proactively Communicate Known Issues:** Maintain a public-facing list of known issues and their estimated resolution times to keep users informed and manage expectations.
**Invest in Automated Testing:** Increase investment in automated testing, particularly for update processes, to catch compatibility issues and bugs before release.
